gw.cc.financials.entity

Interface ReserveLine


  • public interface ReserveLine
    ReserveLine A unique combination of Claim, Exposure, CostType and CostCategory against which reserves can be set and payments made.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • setAvailableReserves

        @Deprecated
Reserve setAvailableReserves(java.math.BigDecimal newReserveAmount,
                                         User submittingUser)
                                  throws com.guidewire.cc.system.exception.ClosedClaimException,
                                         com.guidewire.cc.system.exception.ClosedExposureException,
                                         com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientAuthorityException
        Deprecated. this may not work as expected if called on a reserve line with whose reserving currency is different from the claim currency
        Sets the available reserves for this reserve line to the given amount by creating a reserve that increases or decreases the currently available reserves. This method creates a new ReserveSet and Reserve transaction with the amount necessary to get the AvailableReserves for this ReserveLine to equal the newReserveAmount. This transaction amount might be positive if an increase is needed or negative if a decrease is needed. The ReserveSet is not run through pre-setup rules and is immediately submitted for approval. Unlike setting reserves in the UI, this method ignores any Reserve transactions on this ReserveLine with a status of Pending Approval (since the AvailableReserves calculation does not include PendingApproval reserves). If the current AvailableReserves amount is already equal to newReserveAmount, then this method does not create a new Reserve nor ReserveSet, and returns null.
        Parameters:
        newReserveAmount - The amount the open reserves should be. The amount must be non-null and zero or greater, not negative.
        submittingUser - User submitting this reserve.
        Returns:
        the new reserve (Note: the amount of the returned reserve should not be changed) The method will return null if new reserve is not created.
        Throws:
        com.guidewire.cc.system.exception.ClosedClaimException - if the claim is closed (reserves cannot be created on closed claims)
        com.guidewire.cc.system.exception.ClosedExposureException - if the exposure is closed (reserves cannot be created on closed exposures)
        com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientAuthorityException - if the submitting user does not have authority to create the reserve

      • setOpenRecoveryReserves

        @Deprecated
RecoveryReserve setOpenRecoveryReserves(RecoveryCategory recoveryCategory,
                                                    java.math.BigDecimal newRecoveryReserveAmount,
                                                    User submittingUser)
                                             throws com.guidewire.cc.system.exception.ClosedClaimException,
                                                    com.guidewire.cc.system.exception.ClosedExposureException,
                                                    com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientAuthorityException,
                                                    com.guidewire.cc.system.exception.RecoveryReservesNotAllowedException
        Deprecated. this may not work as expected if called on a reserve line with whose reserving currency is different from the claim currency
        Sets the open recovery reserves for this reserve line to the given amount by creating a recovery reserve that increases or decreases the current open recovery reserves.
        Parameters:
        recoveryCategory - The recovery category for the recovery reserve. This value can be null.
        newRecoveryReserveAmount - The amount the open recovery reserves should be. The amount must be non-null and zero or greater, not negative.
        submittingUser - User submitting this recovery reserve.
        Returns:
        the new Recovery Reserve (Note: the amount of the returned Recovery Reserve should not be changed) The method will return null if new recoveryReserve is not created.
        Throws:
        com.guidewire.cc.system.exception.ClosedClaimException - if the claim is closed (recovery reserves cannot be created on closed claims)
        com.guidewire.cc.system.exception.ClosedExposureException - if the exposure is closed (recovery reserves cannot be created on closed exposures)
        com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientAuthorityException - if the submitting user does not have authority to create the recovery reserve
        com.guidewire.cc.system.exception.RecoveryReservesNotAllowedException - if the system is not configured to allow recovery reserves, i.e., the 'UseRecoveryReserves' parameter is false.

      • getTransactionsIterator

        java.util.Iterator<Transaction> getTransactionsIterator(boolean newAndModifiedOnly)

        Constructs an Iterator to provide access to the transactions for this reserveline. This is a more efficient alternative to calling #getTransactions(), particularly if you are only interested in new or modified transactions. You can use this method to retrieve all the Transaction objects or only the new and modified objects. If you choose to retrieve all the Transaction objects then, those transactions that were removed in the current transaction are not be returned by the Iterator.

        Note: When newAndModifiedOnly is false, there is no guarantee that the beans returned by this iterator may not be in the same bundle as this ReserveLine, and their bundle may not be editable. To edit the beans, you should add them to an editable bundle first.

        Parameters:
        newAndModifiedOnly - if true then only new and modified transactions for this reserveline are returned. This includes transactions for which only the line items were modified. Otherwise, if false then the method returns all transactions for the reserveline, including new and modified Transaction objects, but excluding deleted transactions.
        Returns:
        an Iterator that returns transactions.

      • getPaymentsIterator

        java.util.Iterator<Payment> getPaymentsIterator(boolean newAndModifiedOnly)

        Constructs an Iterator to provide access to the Payment objects for this reserveline. You can choose to get either all the payments or only the new and modified payments. If you choose to get all the Payment objects, then Payment objects in the current transaction are not be returned by the Iterator. This method is a much more efficient alternative to calling #getTransactions() and iterating through all the transactions to find just the desired Payment objects.

        Note: When newAndModifiedOnly is false, the beans returned by this iterator are not guaranteed to be in the same bundle as this ReserveLine, and their bundle may not be editable. To edit the beans, you should add them to an editable bundle first.

        Parameters:
        newAndModifiedOnly - if true then only new and modified Payment objects for this reserveline are returned. This includes payments for which only the line items were modified. Otherwise, if false then all Payment objects for the reserveline are returned, including new and modified Payment objects, but excluding deleted Payment objects.
        Returns:
        an Iterator that returns Payment objects.
